availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Ann Blakey in Adair County on December 30, 1832. Father of William F. Collins, Catherin Collins, Elizabth Collins, Thomas Collins, James Collins, Timothy Collins, Mary A. Collins, John M. Collins, Sidney Collins, Louvina Collins, Prudy A. Collins, Emily Collins and Rosetta Collins. Married to Mahallie Womack in Adair County in 1860. Father of Nancy J. Collins and Wesley Collins. Farmer in Adair County in 1850. Farmer in Adair County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County District 2, p. 63B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 1, p. 127.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Harmony, p. 95B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, Glenville, p. 67B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Adair County Marriages, p. 136.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 25356.
